storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications of assigned tasks to achieve awareness and timely action

testCases.title: Receive notification on task assignment
preconditions: Employee account is active and authenticated in the system
Manager account has permission to assign tasks
Notification service is running and operational
Employee has access to notification dashboard

steps.action: Manager logs into the system and navigates to task management section
steps.expectedResult: Task management interface is displayed successfully

steps.action: Manager creates a new task with title, description, deadline, and priority
steps.expectedResult: Task creation form accepts all required fields

steps.action: Manager assigns the task to a specific employee and submits the assignment
steps.expectedResult: Task assignment is processed successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Wait for notification delivery (maximum 5 minutes)
steps.expectedResult: System triggers notification within the specified timeframe

steps.action: Employee checks for new notifications in their notification center or email
steps.expectedResult: Notification is displayed with task title, description, deadline, priority, and action link

steps.action: Employee navigates to notification history in their dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page loads successfully

steps.action: Employee verifies the task assignment notification appears in the history list
steps.expectedResult: Notification is listed in history with timestamp, task details, and read/unread status

postconditions: Task assignment notification is recorded in notification history
Employee is aware of the newly assigned task
Notification status is marked as delivered in the system

testCases.title: Receive notification on deadline change
preconditions: Employee account is active and authenticated
Manager has permission to update task deadlines
An existing task is already assigned to the employee
Notification service is operational
Employee has access to notification acknowledgment features

steps.action: Manager logs into the system and navigates to the assigned task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with current deadline information

steps.action: Manager selects the option to edit task deadline
steps.expectedResult: Deadline edit interface is displayed with current deadline value

steps.action: Manager updates the task deadline to a new date and saves the changes
steps.expectedResult: Deadline update is processed successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Wait for notification delivery (maximum 5 minutes)
steps.expectedResult: System triggers notification for deadline change within specified timeframe

steps.action: Employee checks for new notifications in their notification center
steps.expectedResult: Notification is displayed showing the task name, old deadline, new deadline, and reason for change

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Notification expands to show complete task information with updated deadline highlighted

steps.action: Employee clicks the acknowledge button on the notification
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is recorded and notification is marked as acknowledged

steps.action: Verify acknowledgment status in the notification history
steps.expectedResult: Notification shows acknowledgment timestamp and acknowledged status

postconditions: Deadline change notification is recorded in notification history
Employee acknowledgment is saved in the system
Task displays updated deadline information
Notification is marked as read and acknowledged

testCases.title: Verify notification delivery under load
preconditions: Multiple employee accounts are active in the system
Manager has permission to assign tasks to multiple employees
Notification service is operational and monitored
Performance monitoring tools are configured
Test environment can simulate concurrent operations

steps.action: Prepare a list of 50 tasks with varying priorities and deadlines
steps.expectedResult: Task data is prepared and ready for bulk assignment

steps.action: Manager initiates concurrent task assignments to 50 different employees simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: All 50 task assignments are submitted to the system without errors

steps.action: Monitor the notification service to verify all 50 notifications are triggered
steps.expectedResult: System logs show 50 notification triggers with unique task IDs and employee IDs

steps.action: Track notification delivery time for each of the 50 notifications
steps.expectedResult: All notifications are queued for delivery with timestamps recorded

steps.action: Verify that all 50 employees receive their respective notifications within 5 minutes
steps.expectedResult: 100% of notifications are delivered within the 5-minute SLA timeframe

steps.action: Check system performance metrics including CPU usage, memory consumption, and response times
steps.expectedResult: System resources remain within acceptable thresholds (CPU < 80%, Memory < 85%)

steps.action: Review system logs for any errors, warnings, or failed notification deliveries
steps.expectedResult: No errors or delays are observed in system logs; all notifications show successful delivery status

steps.action: Verify database integrity and notification records for all 50 assignments
steps.expectedResult: All notification records are correctly stored with accurate timestamps and delivery status

postconditions: All 50 notifications are successfully delivered and recorded
System performance remains stable under concurrent load
No data loss or corruption occurred during load test
Notification service maintains SLA compliance under stress

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view and track task statuses to achieve effective monitoring of employee work

testCases.title: View task list with statuses
preconditions: Manager account is authenticated and has appropriate permissions
Multiple tasks exist in the system with various statuses (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Blocked)
Tasks have different priorities (High, Medium, Low) and deadlines
Task tracking dashboard is accessible to the manager

steps.action: Manager logs into the system and navigates to the task tracking dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task tracking dashboard loads successfully and displays the complete task list with status indicators (color-coded or icon-based)

steps.action: Verify that each task displays its current status, priority, deadline, assigned employee, and progress percentage
steps.expectedResult: All task information is clearly visible with accurate status indicators for each task

steps.action: Manager clicks on the priority filter dropdown and selects 'High' priority
steps.expectedResult: Task list updates to display only high-priority tasks

steps.action: Manager adds a deadline filter to show tasks due within the next 7 days
steps.expectedResult: Task list further filters to show only high-priority tasks with deadlines in the next 7 days

steps.action: Verify the filtered task count matches the number of tasks displayed
steps.expectedResult: Task counter shows correct number of filtered results

steps.action: Manager clicks on the status column header to sort tasks by status
steps.expectedResult: Tasks are reordered and grouped by status (e.g., Blocked, Not Started, In Progress, Completed) in ascending order

steps.action: Manager clicks the status column header again to reverse the sort order
steps.expectedResult: Tasks are reordered in descending status order

steps.action: Manager clears all filters to view the complete task list again
steps.expectedResult: All tasks are displayed with their respective statuses and the filter indicators are cleared

postconditions: Task list displays accurate and current status information
Filter and sort preferences are maintained during the session
Manager has clear visibility of task distribution across statuses

testCases.title: Update task status successfully
preconditions: Manager is authenticated with task update permissions
At least one task exists with status 'In Progress'
Task status workflow rules are configured in the system
Manager has access to task detail and edit functionality

steps.action: Manager navigates to the task tracking dashboard and locates a task with 'In Progress' status
steps.expectedResult: Task list is displayed and the target task is visible with 'In Progress' status indicator

steps.action: Manager clicks on the task to open task details view
steps.expectedResult: Task details page opens showing complete task information including current status

steps.action: Manager clicks on the status dropdown or edit button to change the task status
steps.expectedResult: Status selection interface is displayed with available status options based on workflow rules

steps.action: Manager selects 'Completed' from the status dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status change is accepted and 'Completed' is highlighted as the selected option

steps.action: Manager adds optional comments explaining the status change
steps.expectedResult: Comment field accepts text input and displays character count if applicable

steps.action: Manager clicks the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to confirm the status update
steps.expectedResult: Status update is processed and a success confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Task status updated successfully')

steps.action: Manager returns to the task tracking dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard reloads and displays the updated task list

steps.action: Manager locates the previously updated task in the task list
steps.expectedResult: Task now displays 'Completed' status with updated timestamp and status indicator color/icon

steps.action: Manager clicks on the task again to verify the status change is persisted
steps.expectedResult: Task details show 'Completed' status with the manager's comment and update timestamp

postconditions: Task status is permanently updated to 'Completed' in the database
Status change is logged in task history with timestamp and user information
Assigned employee receives notification of status change (if applicable)
Task statistics and reports reflect the updated status

testCases.title: Dashboard performance under normal load
preconditions: Manager account is authenticated
System contains a representative dataset of tasks (100-500 tasks)
Network conditions are stable and normal
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure load times
Browser cache is cleared to simulate first-time load

steps.action: Manager navigates to the task tracking dashboard URL and starts timer
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard begins loading and displays loading indicator

steps.action: Measure the time taken for the dashboard to fully load with all task data and status indicators
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads completely within 3 seconds showing all tasks with status indicators, filters, and controls

steps.action: Verify all dashboard elements are interactive and responsive
steps.expectedResult: All buttons, filters, and sorting controls are functional immediately after page load

steps.action: Manager applies a filter for 'High' priority tasks
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied and task list updates within 1 second showing only high-priority tasks

steps.action: Manager adds an additional filter for tasks with 'In Progress' status
steps.expectedResult: Combined filters are applied and task list updates promptly (within 1 second) showing only high-priority, in-progress tasks

steps.action: Manager sorts the filtered results by deadline in ascending order
steps.expectedResult: Tasks are reordered by deadline within 1 second with earliest deadlines appearing first

steps.action: Manager clears all filters and sorts to return to default view
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard resets to show all tasks in default order within 1 second

steps.action: Manager clicks the 'Export' button to generate a CSV report of task statuses
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates and progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for CSV file generation and download to complete
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated and downloaded within 5 seconds containing all task data with correct columns (Task ID, Title, Status, Priority, Deadline, Assigned Employee)

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file and verify data accuracy
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains accurate task information matching the dashboard display with proper formatting

postconditions: Dashboard maintains performance standards under normal load
All filtering and sorting operations complete within acceptable timeframes
Exported CSV file contains accurate and complete task data
System resources return to normal levels after operations complete

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view audit logs of task changes to achieve accountability and traceability

testCases.title: View audit logs filtered by task and date
preconditions: User is logged in with manager role credentials
Manager has authorization to access audit logs
At least one task with change history exists in the system
Audit log database contains historical task change records
Browser is supported and up to date

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log interface by clicking on 'Audit Logs' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Audit log UI is displayed with filter options, search bar, and empty or default log list view

steps.action: Select a specific task from the task filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Task is selected and displayed in the filter field

steps.action: Enter start date in the 'From Date' field using date picker
steps.expectedResult: Start date is populated in the date field in correct format

steps.action: Enter end date in the 'To Date' field using date picker
steps.expectedResult: End date is populated in the date field in correct format

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the filter request and displays filtered audit logs matching the selected task and date range within 3 seconds. Logs show task changes with timestamps, user info, and change details

steps.action: Verify the displayed logs contain only records for the selected task within the specified date range
steps.expectedResult: All displayed logs match the filter criteria with correct task name and dates falling within the specified range

steps.action: Click 'Export' button to download the filtered logs
steps.expectedResult: CSV file download is initiated automatically

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains all filtered log entries with columns for timestamp, user, task, change type, old value, and new value. Data matches the displayed logs exactly

postconditions: Audit logs remain unchanged in the database
Filter selections are retained in the UI
CSV file is saved in the downloads folder
User session remains active

testCases.title: Verify audit logs record all task changes
preconditions: User is logged in with manager role credentials
Manager has permissions to modify tasks and view audit logs
At least one task exists in the system that can be modified
Audit logging service is active and running
System time is synchronized correctly

steps.action: Navigate to the task management interface
steps.expectedResult: Task management interface is displayed with list of available tasks

steps.action: Select a task and reassign it to a different team member
steps.expectedResult: Task assignment is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Modify the deadline of the same task to a new date
steps.expectedResult: Task deadline is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Change the priority of the same task from current priority to a different priority level
steps.expectedResult: Task priority is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log interface
steps.expectedResult: Audit log UI is displayed

steps.action: Filter audit logs by the modified task ID or name
steps.expectedResult: System displays all audit log entries for the selected task

steps.action: Verify that the assignment change is recorded in the audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry shows the assignment change with old assignee, new assignee, change type as 'Assignment', timestamp, and user who made the change

steps.action: Verify that the deadline change is recorded in the audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry shows the deadline change with old deadline, new deadline, change type as 'Deadline', timestamp, and user who made the change

steps.action: Verify that the priority change is recorded in the audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry shows the priority change with old priority, new priority, change type as 'Priority', timestamp, and user who made the change

steps.action: Check the timestamps for all three log entries
steps.expectedResult: All timestamps are accurate, reflect the actual time of changes, and are in chronological order

steps.action: Check the user information for all three log entries
steps.expectedResult: User information is complete and accurate, showing the correct username or user ID of the manager who performed each change

postconditions: All three task changes are permanently recorded in the audit log database
Task reflects the final modified state with new assignment, deadline, and priority
Audit logs are available for future queries and compliance reviews
No data integrity issues exist in the audit trail

testCases.title: Ensure audit log access is restricted
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
At least one unauthorized user account exists (non-manager role)
At least one authorized manager account exists
Audit logs contain data in the system
Authentication and authorization services are functioning

steps.action: Log in to the system using unauthorized user credentials (e.g., team member or developer role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system with non-manager role

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the audit log interface by entering the audit log URL directly or clicking the menu option if visible
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'You do not have permission to access audit logs' or 'Access Denied - Manager authorization required'. User is redirected to home page or error page

steps.action: Attempt to access audit logs via API endpoint GET /api/tasks/auditlogs using unauthorized user token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in to the system using authorized manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and logged into the system with manager role

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log interface by clicking on 'Audit Logs' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and audit log UI is displayed with full functionality including filters, search, and export options

steps.action: Verify that audit logs are visible and contain task change records
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are displayed with complete information including timestamps, user details, task changes, and change types

steps.action: Access audit logs via API endpoint GET /api/tasks/auditlogs using authorized manager token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 200 OK status code with JSON response containing audit log data

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are logged in security logs
Authorized manager retains access to audit logs
No unauthorized data exposure occurred
System security policies remain enforced
User sessions are properly managed
